definition[0]: to keep a person or a group of people away from other people
example[0]: The jury were sequestered during the trial.
definition[2]: to make a group of people, such as a JURY, stay away from other people
example[1]: The jurors were sequestered under guard for the remainder of the trial.
definition[4]: an order by the US government stating that a government organization or department must reduce the money it spends
example[2]: If the projected deficit is more than $74 billion, a sequester will be administered.
example[3]: Education and labor are among the agencies scheduled forsequester cuts.
